statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Petka thought of a positive integer n and reported to Chapayev the sum of its digits and the sum of its squared digits. Chapayev scratched his head and said: "Well, Petka, I won't find just your number, but I can find the smallest fitting number." Can you do the same?

statement.title: Input
statement.content: The first line contains the number of test cases t (no more than 10000). In each of the following t lines there are numbers s1 and s2 (1 �� s1, s2 �� 10000) separated by a space. They are the sum of digits and the sum of squared digits of the number n.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, output in a separate line the smallest fitting number n, or "No solution" if there is no such number or if it contains more than 100 digits.

statement.title: Source
statement.content: 2009 Multi-University Training Contest 6 - Host by WHU
